instrument.name: Baglamas (3x2 Strings)
instrument.description: aka: Baglama, Baglama Saz, Baglamadaki Origin: Greece

instrument.name: Bandurria (6x2 Strings) - Standard
instrument.description: Note: Although called Standard most bandurria players use the tunings Spanish and Philippine.

instrument.name: Mandolin Banjo (4x2 Strings)
instrument.description:
Origin: USA
Note: neck of a mandolin and the body of a banjo; tuned identically to the mandolin

instrument.name: Banjolele (4 Strings) - C
instrument.description:
aka: Ukulele Banjo, Banjo Ukulele, Banjo Uke Origin: USA
Note: neck of an ukulele and the body of a banjo

instrument.name: Banjitar (6 Strings)
instrument.description:
aka: Guitar Banjo, Guitjo Origin: USA
Note: neck of a guitar and the body of a banjo

instrument.name: Bassjo (4 Strings)
instrument.description:
Origin: USA
Note: neck of a bass (guitar) and the body of a banjo

instrument.name: Banjolele (4 Strings) - D
instrument.description:
aka: Ukulele Banjo, Banjo Ukulele, Banjo Uke Origin: USA
Note: neck of an ukulele and the body of a banjo

instrument.name: Banjolin (4 Strings)
instrument.description:
aka: Soprano Banjo Origin: USA
Note: related to the mandolin banjo but without paired courses; tuned identically to the mandolin

instrument.name: Banjola (5 Strings) - C
instrument.description:
aka: Mandola Banjo Origin: USA
Note: neck of a banjo and the body of a mandola/mandolin

instrument.name: Banjola (5 Strings) - Open G
instrument.description:
aka: Mandola Banjo Origin: USA
Note: neck of a banjo and the body of a mandola/mandolin

instrument.name: Banjola (6 Strings)
instrument.description:
aka: Mandola Banjo Origin: USA
Note: neck of a banjo and the body of a mandola/mandolin

instrument.name: Banjo (4 Strings) - Tenor
instrument.description:
aka: Tenor Banjo Origin: USA
Note: tuned like a tenor guitar

instrument.name: Banjo (4 Strings) - Irish Tenor
instrument.description: aka: Irish Banjo; Irish Tenor Tuning Origin: USA

instrument.name: Banjo (4 Strings) - Chicago
instrument.description:
aka: Chicago Tuning Origin: USA
Note: tuned like the top four strings of a guitar

instrument.name: Banjo (5 Strings) - Sawmill
instrument.description: aka: Mountain Modal Tuning Origin: USA

instrument.name: Cello Banjo (4 Strings)
instrument.description:
Origin: USA
Note: tuned like a mandocello

instrument.name: Cello Banjo (5 Strings)
instrument.description:
Origin: USA
Note: 5-string bluegrass tuning (open G) one octave lower

instrument.name: Bass Banjo (4 Strings)
instrument.description:
Origin: USA
Note: tuned like a contrabass and mandobass

instrument.name: Bass Guitar (6 Strings) - High B
instrument.description: Note: matches the first five strings of the guitar standard tuning (but one octave lower)

instrument.name: Bass Guitar (6 Strings) - Guitar
instrument.description: Note: matches the guitar standard tuning but one octave lower

instrument.description: aka: Quirquincho, Mulita, Tatu, Kirki Origin: Andes (Bolivia, Peru, Argentina, Chile, Ecuador)

instrument.name: Charangon (5x2 Strings) - F6
instrument.description:
aka: Bariton Charango Origin: Andes (Bolivia, Peru, Argentina, Chile, Ecuador)
Note: larger variant of the charango; tuned a fifth lower than a charango

instrument.name: Charangon (5x2 Strings) - G6
instrument.description:
aka: Bariton Charango Origin: Andes (Bolivia, Peru, Argentina, Chile, Ecuador)
Note: larger variant of the charango; tuned a fourth lower than a charango

instrument.name: Ronroco (5x2 Strings) - Argentina
instrument.description:
aka: Ronrroco, Ronrojo Origin: Andes
Note: larger variant of the charango; tuned a fourth lower than a charango, same as G6 charangon tuning

instrument.name: Ronroco (5x2 Strings) - Standard
instrument.description:
aka: Ronrroco, Ronrojo Origin: Andes
Note: larger variant of the charango; tuned an octave lower than a charango

instrument.name: Walaycho (5x2 Strings) - F6
instrument.description:
aka: Waylacho, Hualaycho, Maulincho Origin: Andes (Bolivia, Peru, Argentina, Chile, Ecuador)
Note: smaller variant of the charango; tuned a fourth higher than a charango

instrument.name: Walaycho (5x2 Strings) - G6
instrument.description:
aka: Waylacho, Hualaycho, Maulincho Origin: Andes (Bolivia, Peru, Argentina, Chile, Ecuador)
Note: smaller variant of the charango; tuned a fifth higher than a charango

instrument.description: aka: Choghur, Chaghyr, Chagur, Chugur Origin: Georgia

instrument.name: Double Bass (4 Strings) - Standard E
instrument.description:
aka: Contrabass Scale length [mm]: 1/16=700, 1/10=750, 1/8=800, 1/4=900, 1/2=1000, 3/4=1050, 7/8=1060
Note: standard, regular or orchestral tuning

instrument.name: Double Bass (4 Strings) - F#
instrument.description:
aka: Contrabass Scale length [mm]: 1/16=700, 1/10=750, 1/8=800, 1/4=900, 1/2=1000, 3/4=1050, 7/8=1060
Note: standard tuning ,E-,A-D-G tuned a whole tone higher, usually used for classical solo play = solo tuning

instrument.name: Double Bass (4 Strings) - C
instrument.description:
aka: Contrabass Scale length [mm]: 1/16=700, 1/10=750, 1/8=800, 1/4=900, 1/2=1000, 3/4=1050, 7/8=1060
Note: tuned in fifths like a cello but an octave lower

instrument.name: Double Bass (5 Strings) - C
instrument.description:
aka: Contrabass Scale length [mm]: 1/16=700, 1/10=750, 1/8=800, 1/4=900, 1/2=1000, 3/4=1050, 7/8=1060
Note: double bass with a low C extension; extended bass

instrument.name: Double Bass (5 Strings) - E
instrument.description:
aka: Contrabass Scale length [mm]: 1/16=700, 1/10=750, 1/8=800, 1/4=900, 1/2=1000, 3/4=1050, 7/8=1060
Note: double bass with a high B extension; extended soprano

instrument.name: Double Bass (5 Strings) - B
instrument.description:
aka: Contrabass Scale length [mm]: 1/16=700, 1/10=750, 1/8=800, 1/4=900, 1/2=1000, 3/4=1050, 7/8=1060
Note: double bass with a low B extension; extended bass

instrument.name: Oud (6x2 Strings) - Turkish
instrument.description:
aka: Ud, Al-ud, Oud Arbi Origin: Middle East
Note: lowest course is actually just a single string; tuning: C# - F#F# - BB - ee - aa - d'd'

instrument.name: Oud (6x2 Strings) - Arabic
instrument.description:
aka: Ud, Al-ud, Oud Arbi Origin: Middle East
Note: lowest course is actually just a single string; tuning: D - GG - AA - dd - gg - c'c'

instrument.name: Bisernica (4 Strings)
instrument.description:
aka: Prim, Prima, Pirma Origin: Croatia, Serbia, Slovenia
Note: highest course is usually doubled; tuning: e-a-d'-g'g'

instrument.name: Brac (4 Strings)
instrument.description:
aka: Basprim, Brach, Bracs, Basszprim Origin: Croatia, Serbia, Slovenia
Note: highest course is usually doubled; tuning: E-A-d-gg

instrument.name: Berda (4 Strings)
instrument.description:
aka: Bas, Beges, Berde, Bogos, Tamburabogo Origin: Croatia, Serbia, Slovenia
Note: tuned like a contrabass

instrument.name: Bugarija (4 Strings)
instrument.description:
aka: Kontra, Beglait, Bracso Origin: Croatia, Serbia, Slovenia
Note: highest course is usually doubled; tuning: g-b-d'-g'g'

instrument.name: Timple (5 Strings)
instrument.description: aka: Timple Canario Origin: Canary Islands, Spain

instrument.name: Tiple (4x2 Strings) - American
instrument.description:
aka: Tiple Ukulele, Martin Tiple Origin: USA
Note: 2nd and 3rd course are actually triple; tuning: aa' - d'dd' - f#'f#f#' - b'b'

instrument.name: Tiple (5 Strings) - Puerto Rican
instrument.description: aka: Tiple Doliente Origin: Puerto Rico

instrument.name: Tiple (4x2 Strings) - Colombian
instrument.description:
aka: Tiple Colombiano Origin: Colombia
Note: all courses are actually triple; tuning: c'cc' - e'ee' - a'aa' - d'd'd'

instrument.name: Tiple (4x2 Strings) - Colombian - G6
instrument.description:
aka: Tiple Colombiano Origin: Colombia
Note: all courses are actually triple; tuning: d'dd' - g'gg' - b'bb' - e'e'e'
